artists.name: Alexander Von Humboldt
artists.description: Famous naturalist. I have a photo of a book 'Alexander bon Humboldt and the United States' that I saw but didn't buy

artists.name: Gustaf Fjaestad
artists.description: 19th century Swedish painter. He has a lot of beautiful winter landscapes and flowing water. He has two pieces in 'Nordic Landscape Painting in the Nineteenth Century', but I added him to the list after seeing 'The Boy Who Sees with His Heart'. Can't find any monographs

artists.name: Heinrich Kley
artists.description: Early cartoonist and satirist, had an influence on Disney. His drawings and sketches are interesting but maybe more interesting for their historical status

artists.name: John Singer Sargent
artists.description: Considered the best portraitist of his generation, American expat, beautiful painting style, probably gay. Read about him first on Kottke. WSU libraries have a bunch of books about him

artists.name: FÃ©lix Vallotton
artists.description: French artist that produced paintings and woodcuts in several styles. WSU libraries have two books about him, the Royal Academy of Arts one is probably best

artists.name: Mikhail Nesterov
artists.description: Russian painter known for Russian Symbolism, which is to say traditional Russian scenes with deep meaning

artists.name: Nicholas Roerich
artists.description: Russian painter and mystic; I have a book of some of his works, but it's mostly focused on the later work and I want to see more of the earlier stuff

topics.description: Custom design for theater with artists including Leon Bakst
I'm interested in a book with Gustaf Fjaestad and Anna Boberg

books.title: Tales of Mystery and Imagination
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.description: The illustrations by Harry Clarke are weird and beautiful. I think WSU libraries has a copy I can check out first

books.title: J.C. Leyendecker
books.author: Laurence S. Cutler
books.description: I read an interesting article about him and his homoerotic art on Messy Nessy and am very interested in learning more. It looks like this is the best book on the subject
